flavor: "The Empress declared a great celebration to mark the victory, and the Champions of the Great Clans were honored with invitations to her court." - The Chronicles of Empress Iweko, Part V
text: Discard zero to two cards; each other player in turn order may discard a card. Each player then draws as many cards as he discarded.

title: A New Year
flavor: With each new year come new challenges and celebrations, but few years see the ascension of a new Emperor. When it occurs, a series of twenty festivals is held to commemorate the occasion.
text: Open: Discard zero to two cards; each other player in turn order may discard a card. Each player then draws as many cards as he discarded.
Open: Discard zero to two cards; each other player in turn order may discard a card. Each player then draws as many cards as he discarded.
title: A New Year

flavor: "You have come to take me to the islands, then?" "No my lady," Okame replied. "We have come to defend your home."
text: Until the end of the game, after any action resolves that produced a Ranged Attack, if any target of the Ranged Attack is still in play, straighten any cards that performed the action.

notes: Legal July 1st, 2015 • Thunderous Acclaim Pre-release Promo
title: A Prophet Revealed
flavor: "All over the Empire, there are others now experiencing the same visions. But only you have had this gift for so long, and at last, I have found you, Kitsune Narako." - Hira, formerly Asahina Hira, Keeper of the Void
text:
After your action resolves, if any targets of its Ranged Attacks are still in play, straighten any of your cards that the action and combining abilities bowed.
Open: Put this Event into play.

title: A Prophet Revealed

flavor: "From east to west the samurai of the Empire girded themselves for war, and answered the Empress's call to do great deeds in her name. The skies were filled with the banners of the Great Clans." - The Chronicles of Empress Iweko, Part II
text: Each player with more than 20 Family Honor loses 5 Honor.

flavor: "Hachi and the Anvil had come to an agreement at last. Ironically, it was then that the Horde attacked Otosan Uchi."
"Because the battle has ended, you think that we should grow comfortable? There is never a better time for action than when it is not yet needed. Now is the time for preparation."
text: Open: Each player with 21 or more Family Honor loses 5 Honor.
title: A Time for Action

text: Open: Each player with 21 or more Family Honor loses 5 Honor.
title: A Time for Action

flavor: When Naseru brokered the alliance between the Lion and the Phoenix, his plan was for Lion might and Isawa magic to smash the Shadowlands once and for all. Unfortunately, the Dragon refugees crossing both Lion and Phoenix borders only further unified the two clans against a common threat.
text: Select a Faction other than your own. For the rest of the game, you can bring Personalities of that Faction into play for 2 less Gold.

flavor: "Any man who does not consider me an ally is an enemy." - Hida Kisada
Two men can brave what one man cannot.
Two men can brave what one man cannot.
"Our clans have shared both friendship and enmity. We must now ask ourselves, which one brought greater benefit to us both?"
text:
You do not pay the extra two Gold for bringing Personalities with the named Clan Alignment into play.
Open: Put this Event into play. Name a Clan Alignment other than your own.
title: Alliance

text:
You do not pay the extra two Gold for bringing Personalities with the named Clan Alignment into play.
Open: Put this Event into play. Name a Clan Alignment other than your own.

text: Before a player's turn ends this game, if the player, during that turn, destroyed a province in battle resolution, put at least two Rings into play by their own text, and gained 7 or more Honor, he may, as costs, discard the Imperial Favor and pay 10 Gold. If he does so, he wins the game.

flavor: Who shall be worthy?

notes: Legal April 1st, 2015 • Twenty Festivals Pre-release Promo
text:
Players have the ability, "Dynasty: If you, this turn, destroyed a Province in battle resolution, put two Rings into play by their own text, and gained 7 Honor, you may discard the Imperial Favor and pay 10 Gold to win the game."

text: Until you are eliminated, all players draw an additional Fate card during their End Phases, and each time a player needs to draw a Fate card but cannot because his Fate deck is empty, destroy his rightmost Province.

flavor: "Defeated and cast out from his city, the Dark Lord would nevertheless return stronger than ever." - Chronicle of the Spider Clan

notes: Legal January 1st, 2016 • The Blackest Storm Pre-release Promo
title: Doom of the Dark Lord
flavor: The soul of Goju Kyoden has returned from death yet again. But does this bode ill for the enemies of Kanpeki, or for the son of Daigotsu himself?
text:
Each player draws an additional card at the end of his turn. After each time a player must draw a card but cannot because his deck is empty, destroy his rightmost Province.
Open: Put this Event into play.

Each player draws an additional card at the end of his turn. After each time a player must draw a card but cannot because his deck is empty, destroy his rightmost Province.
Open: Put this Event into play.
title: Doom of the Dark Lord

flavor: The lords of the Empire gather weapons and men, preparing for the conflicts they can see on the horizon.
text: Until the game ends, during each player's End Phase, he may draw an additional card if he brought any Followers into play from his hand that turn.

flavor: "Your life is owed to the Emperor, peasant. Serve him, or I will collect that debt."
Your place is not in the fields of rice, but fields of battle!
"To arms, you filthy dogs! The time has come to teach the Scorpion a lesson!"

title: Enlistment
flavor: Even among the loyal people of Rokugan, there are some who do not wish to serve unless forced.
text:
Each player may draw an additional card before his turn ends if he Equipped any Followers from his hand since his last turn ended.
Open: Put this Event into play.

notes: Some variants of the Pearl Edition version of this card were printed with a different text alignment.

flavor: Three hundred years ago, a sandalwood fan convinced the Court that the Unicorn Clan was indeed Shinjo's people returned from their quest.
text: Draw an extra card during your End Phase this turn.

flavor: She was a sign of good luck, foretelling fortune in our future.
She was a sign of good luck, foretelling fortune in our future.

"All things are necessary - war, peace, the edge of the sword, and the sound of a poem. With understanding, all things are one." - from the True Tao of Shinsei
Three hundred years ago, a sandalwood fan convinced the Court that the Unicorn Clan was indeed Shinjo's people returned from their quest.
The ki-rin is an ancient and sacred creature of legend. It appears in the mortal realm perhaps once each generation, and those who see it are blessed.
text: Dynasty: Draw a card. (You may only take Dynasty actions during your Dynasty Phase.)
title: Glimpse of the Unicorn

text: Dynasty: Draw a card. (You may only take Dynasty actions during your Dynasty Phase.)

flavor: "Your efforts are a great boon to the alliance, noble warrior. You honor us all with your prowess."
text: Until the game ends, after each time a player destroys a province by winning a battle, he gains 3 Honor.

flavor: "The Lion respect the Phoenix, my lord, but your intervention in this matter is unwelcome. Stand aside, or our alliance will suffer for it."
"I bring you a gift, the head of the man who shamed both our houses. Perhaps now we can grow in strength together once again."
text:
After each time an Attacker destroys a province by winning a battle, he gains 3 Honor.

title: Military Alliance

text:
After each time an Attacker destroys a province by winning a battle, he gains 3 Honor.

title: Military Alliance

flavor: One by one, each star in the Celestial Heavens awakened, following the light of a golden colt.
text: Each Nonhuman Personality gains +1F/+1C. Each Nonhuman Follower gains +1F.

flavor: "Tales of spirits, wondrous events, even sightings of the elemental dragons." The Phoenix shugenja's eyes were alight. "The Heavens are clear in their blessings of the Iweko Dynasty."
text: Open: Give each Nonhuman Personality +1F/+1C and give each Nonhuman Follower +1F.
title: Return of Myth

text: Open: Give each Nonhuman Personality +1F/+1C and give each Nonhuman Follower +1F.

flavor: Foreigners are seldom welcomed in the Empire.

flavor: "The Colonies have their purpose, certainly, but respectable? There are gaijin living there." - Bayushi Nitoshi

flavor: "The Lost are slaves to corruption, mere pawns of the power of Fu Leng. Powerful Bloodspeakers such as Iuchiban and myself have learned to use outside magic to control the Taint. We are the true masters of darkness." - Yajinden's Journals
text: Permanently lower the strength of each Province by 1.

flavor: "The gibbering things marched openly through the streets, wearing the colors of the Hantei. None dared show themselves for fear of joining their ranks." - The Fall of the Hantei, Volume I

notes: Legal October 1st, 2015 • Evil Portents Pre-release Promo
title: Shadow of the Dark God
flavor: Shadows grow ever longer as the sun sets... and, some say, this shadow bears a pair of horns.

flavor: "It seems as if winter comes sooner every year." - Satoshi
text: Until the beginning of your next turn, each player may take only one Limited or Open action during each Action Phase. (This does not affect battles.)

flavor: The winter season was short and quite mild, beginning with the Empress's announcement and ending with a coronation.
text:
Each player may take only one Limited or Open action per turn (after this Event enters play).
Open: If you have not taken an action this phase, put this Event into play. Discard it after the current active player's next Action Phase begins.

Each player may take only one Limited or Open action per turn (after this Event enters play).

flavor: The realm of man erupted once more into war. The representatives of the Celestial Heavens took note of the chaos, and their disapproval grew.
text:
After your next Action Phase begins, turn
all cards in provinces face up, except the
province from which this Event resolved.

flavor: Throughout the Empire, the shugenja of Rokugan were unanimous in their finding that the Celestial Heavens were greatly pleased with the selection of the new Emperor.
text: Open: Turn all cards in other Provinces face-up (including other players' Provinces).

text: Open: Turn all cards in other Provinces face-up (including other players' Provinces).

flavor: The Emerald Legions moved throughout the Empire, ensuring that the Empress's commands were obeyed. Foolish was the lord who tried to defy a legion commander.
text: You may destroy your rightmost Province; if you do so, permanently increase the amount of Honor needed to achieve an Honor Victory by 10.

flavor: "The time has come for the Empire to be reunited," Tsai said to the Legionnaires. "All will bow. Either by choice or before the Emperor's sword."

title: The New Order
flavor: Whenever power changes hands, there are those who seek opportunity.
text:
This Event may not be discarded from play (though its Open action may be negated normally). Players need 10 more Honor to win an Honor Victory.
Political Open: Destroy your rightmost Province. Put this Event into play.

title: The New Order

flavor: "In twenty years of relative peace and exploration, we have learned so much. We must be ever vigilant to ensure that wisdom is not forsaken for war." - Shiba Tsukimi
<i>"It may take some time to gain admission to the Empress," Taiko said. "We should learn as much as we can in the meantime." Hideo nodded. "Agreed, Little Hummingbird."

"I saw terrible things within the Shadowlands, my lord, but I cannot speak of it to you, or it could bring ruination to you, and to the clan. If for this you wish my seppuku, I will gladly grant it." - Akodo Shunori
"The Brothers of Shinsei are the custodians of the prophet's wisdom." - Togashi Mitsu
It was the wisdom of a simple man that saved an Empire. The Keepers are sworn to uphold his legacy.
"Remember. Think. Feel. Act. Simple things upon which the fate of the Empire turns." - Mirumoto Masae
It was the wisdom of a simple man that saved an Empire. The Keepers are sworn to uphold his legacy.
"There is little wisdom to be gained in the keeping of secrets, brother Lion. It was the Scorpion who took the papers… and who laid the blame at your feet."

"I saw terrible things within the Shadowlands, my lord, but I cannot speak of it to you, or it could bring ruination to you, and to the clan. If for this you wish my seppuku, I will gladly grant it." - Akodo Shunori
The only truth you find in distant lands is the truth you carry with you.
Some seek the wisdom of the universe within monasteries, severing themselves from all outside influences. Others immerse themselves in the natural world in hopes of becoming one with it.
text: Open: Starting with you, each player may search his discard pile and Fate deck for a Ring, show it, and put it in his hand.

text: Starting with you, each player may search his discard pile and Fate deck for a Ring, show it, and put it in his hand.

flavor: The Mantis viewed the whole of the Colonies as their domain, regardless of the feelings of the other clans. With certain hidden threats eliminated, the Mantis turned their attention toward threats long forgotten, and began seeking a northern route to distant Medinaat al-Salaam.
use: In which the Mantis begin searching for the northern route to Medinaat al-Salaam.
designernotes:
Art: Mantis Scouts exploring the Northern Wastes.
Design: Intentionally non-Unique.

title: Into the Wastes
flavor: "It matters not what the others think," Yoritomo Hiromi said indignantly. "The Colonies are Mantis territory and I wish to know what lies beyond our borders. If there is a threat, we must know."
text: Engage: You have the first opportunity in this battle to pass or take a Battle action, which must come from a card in a unit.
designernotes:
Art: Mantis Scouts exploring the Northern Wastes.
Design: Intentionally non-Unique.

text: Engage: You have the first opportunity in this battle to pass or take a Battle action, which must come from a card in a unit.
title: Into the Wastes

text:
After a player gains Honor, or any of his opponents lose Honor from the rulebook or cards they do not own, give him an equal number of Influence tokens. A player who begins his turn with 50 or more Influence tokens wins the game. This Event will not be discarded from play, nor have its effects prevented.
Political Open: If no player controls a copy of Political Standoff, put this Event into play.
erratum: Tech errata to clarify the scope of its prevention trait, via Oracle.
title: Political Standoff

flavor: Though it has been long months since she stepped down, the abdication of the Jade Champion remains a matter of brisk discussion.
use: This is the forced Retirement of the Jade Champion
designernotes: Asahina Nanae resignating from the Jade Champion position, looking both angry and ashamed.

text:
Reduce all Honor gains and losses from Holdings by 1 (minimum zero).
Open: Put this Event into play. Discard it before your next turn ends. You may target and dishonor a Crane Clan Personality.
title: Abdication

flavor: Although the two sons of the Divine Empress did not sanction action against one another, their followers were happy to take that initiative on their own.
use: An Event that interacts with the "Support" cards below, should deal with violence breaking out in the Second City and clans picking a side
designernotes: When violence breaks out in the Second City, samurai have to choose whom they support

text:
Political Open: Search your Fate deck for an Allegiance card, show it, and put it in your hand.
Political Open: Discard a target Allegiance card in play. Refill this Province face-up.
title: The Samurai Caste Divides

flavor: The forces of the Dark Naga, mistakenly believed dead, emerged from the wilderness to lay siege to the Second City. The blood of man and Naga alike flooded the streets.
use: The Dark Naga wages war on the Colonies
designernotes: Art Notes - The Dark Naga and the Shakash leading a massive army of naga from the seas to assault a waiting army of samurai. Should feel epic and desperate.

text: Open: Permanently give your target Personality Resilient. If you have fewer Provinces than each other player, permanently give him Conqueror and refill this Province face-up.
title: The Serpent War

flavor: The arrival of an Imperial heir is cause for circumstance for every city.
designernotes: Artwork has Seiken disembarking from a boat.

text: Political Battle/Open: Take the Imperial Favor.
title: Auspicious Arrival

flavor: "It does not matter if you think you do not play the game," she said, smiling. "Everyone plays. Those who claim to avoid it simply lose."
use: This should have something to do with Seiken's attitude towards the Governess

text:
After a player's Favor action resolves, he loses 2 Honor.
Open: Put this Event into play. Discard it after your second turn from now begins.
title: Denial

flavor: The Emperor's Blessing will help the needy rebuild their homes, restoring them to their former glory.
use: This should do something with Iweko being presented with the Blood of the Preserver
designernotes: Notes: Shows the positive effects that the Blood has on the earth, as mentioned on the Kotei pack cards. It's bountiful.

text: Economic Open: Target your Holding. After your next turn begins, give it a +1 Gold Production Wealth token.
title: The Blessing

flavor: The military force of the traditionalists was vastly larger than their opponents', and a swift victory was anticipated. They reckoned without the duplicity of the Scorpion, however.
designernotes: [Note: The traditionalists suffer a rout when the Scorpion betray them.]

text: Interrupt: You may choose a different one of your (legal) Personalities for the action to target instead of the one chosen by another player, now or after he chooses the target.
title: Devastating Betrayal

flavor: Throughout Rokugan's history, there have been occasions when Emperors have retired to their personal chambers for an extensive period of time in order to contemplate matters of great importance.
designernotes: Notes - Seclusion and protection. Iweko alone at a shrine meditating. This is Iweko going into seclusion to determine who the heir should be.

text: Open: Remove your target Personality from the game. Search your Dynasty deck for a Personality with equal or lower Gold Cost and refill this Province with him face-up.
title: Seclusion

flavor: The certainty of the Heavens rained down upon the mortal mind of a man named Enomoto, and he was shattered by it. Far away, the aged monk Hira felt something stir within him. "What… what is this I see?" he wondered idly. "What is happening?"
designernotes: Asahina Hira knows something just happened to the world. Enomoto gets crazy visions, writes them down, then dies. Not sure which should be depicted here, maybe both? Either way, this is about the same Prophecy

text:
You have the ability, "Open: Give a target face-up card in your Province Kharmic."
Open: Put this Event into play.
title: A Vision Imparted

flavor: The season of festivals ended finally in a week of merriment before the coronation of Iweko II.
designernotes: [Note: This is the end of the 90 days of Festivals. I figure this could be the last one, signaling the end. Makes it so being down on Provinces does not also mean you are down on the number of cards you can buy.]

text:
You have the ability, "Open: If you have fewer Provinces than one other player, then a number of times per turn equal to the difference (now), you may refill one of your Provinces face-up."
Open: If you have not resolved a Coronation Festival this game, put this Event into play.
title: Coronation Festival

flavor: Kanpeki looked at the burning banner, then back to his men. "We have kept our oaths, and they have broken theirs. You know, as I know, what this means. I will not have my father's name slandered. The Empire must burn."
designernotes: Art - Kanpeki and the Spider Clan Court delegates look on as the Spider Clan is disbanded by Imperial Decree.

text:
You have the ability, "Battle: If your current army is opposed, discard a card to draw a card."
Open: Put this Event into play.
title: Exodus of the Spider

flavor: The Spider's unholy army outnumbered the temple's defenders more than fifty to one. The samurai fought with honor, but they could not hold back the dark tide. Renyu and Norimichi's magic tore the world asunder, but when Norimichi fell, their defeat was inevitable.
designernotes: [Art Note: The First Seal is destroyed.]

text: Open: Dark times are coming. Personalities with 3 or more Personal Honor have -1F. Personalities with 0 Personal Honor have +1F.
title: Battle of the First Seal

flavor: The crowd fell silent as Kozan continued. "The Dark Lord has chosen to renege on his agreement with the Empress. The Taint endures… it has only remained hidden."
designernotes: Art: Hida Kozan (Voice of the Emperor) reading an official decree in the Imperial Court. The surrounding courtiers look confused and angry. This is Kozan letting people know that Iweko has been suppressing the taint.

text:
Invest :g2:: The Event may be Unique.
Political Open: Search your Dynasty deck for a non-Unique Event not named Ominous Revelation and refill this Province with it, face-up.
title: Ominous Revelation

flavor: As the ancestral guardians shimmered into existence, the samurai-ko licked her lips anxiously. "This was not in the intelligence," she whispered. Then the air shimmered again, and the hungry dead spilled forth. "The Kwanchai's daughter will not be harmed!" they hissed.
designernotes: Disguised as Mantis, a force of Scorpion ninja infiltrate the libraries of Kyuden Miya and Shiro Ikoma to remove any hint of the Three Seals that they might find, possibly planting false evidence in the process. This is an attempt to stop the prophecy from coming to be fulfilled. While the heist at Kyuden Miya goes off without a hitch, the one in the Lion lands does not. The Scorpion are able to deftly avoid the Lion's attention, but the Kitsu have employed the aide of their ancestral spirits to protect major Lion fortifications during the war, and the spirits raise the alarm. When this happens, the leader of the team and the greatest ninja of the Scorpion (also Bayushi Kwanchai's daughter) inadvertently sets off her own legacy and the spirits of gaki-do rush to her defense. Shiro Ikoma quickly becomes the site of a battle between the spirit armies of the blessed ancestors and the hungry dead, giving the Scorpion time to escape and confusing the Lion to no end.

text: Ninja Open, :g2:: You may target and bow a Spell. Search your Fate deck for a Ninja Strategy, show it, and put it in your hand. Lose 2 Honor.
title: War of the Spirit Realms

flavor: "Enough of death. Enough of war. Let there be peace at last." - Toturi, the Black Lion

text:
This Event may not have its effects negated or be discarded from play. After a turn begins, if the active player controls seven Seven Thunder Personalities with no Clan Alignments in common, he or she wins the game.
Open: Put this Event into play.
title: Victory of the Thunders
